pullrequest.title: Several MSVC fixes: standard pointers and enable FreeImage/Ogre in Windows (take II)
Several MSVC fixes: standard pointers and enable FreeImage/Ogre in Windows (take II)

content.raw:
there are some codecheck errors:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_rendering-ci-pr_any-xenial-amd64&build=22)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_rendering-ci-pr_any-xenial-amd64/22/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_rendering-ci-pr_any-xenial-amd64/22/cppcheckResult/

I think the following patch will fix them all:

~~~
diff -r 62e72338329d ogre/src/OgreRenderEngine.cc
--- a/ogre/src/OgreRenderEngine.cc	Wed Jun 27 00:14:09 2018 +0200
+++ b/ogre/src/OgreRenderEngine.cc	Wed Jun 27 15:00:27 2018 -0700
@@ -219,11 +219,13 @@
                 Ogre::MaterialManager::getSingleton().getByName(
                     fullPath);
 
+              bool matPtrNotNull;
               #if (OGRE_VERSION_MAJOR == 1 && OGRE_VERSION_MAJOR < 10)
-              if (! matPtr.isNull())
-              #elif
-              if (matPtr)
+              matPtrNotNull = !matPtr.isNull();
+              #else
+              matPtrNotNull = matPtr != nullptr;
               #endif
+              if (matPtrNotNull)
               {
                 // is this necessary to do here? Someday try it without
                 matPtr->compile();
diff -r 62e72338329d ogre/src/OgreSelectionBuffer.cc
--- a/ogre/src/OgreSelectionBuffer.cc	Wed Jun 27 00:14:09 2018 +0200
+++ b/ogre/src/OgreSelectionBuffer.cc	Wed Jun 27 15:00:27 2018 -0700
@@ -131,7 +131,7 @@
 void OgreSelectionBuffer::DeleteRTTBuffer()
 {
 #if OGRE_VERSION_MAJOR == 1 && OGRE_VERSION_MINOR < 10
-  if (! this->dataPtr->texture.isNull() && this->dataPtr->texture->isLoaded())
+  if (!this->dataPtr->texture.isNull() && this->dataPtr->texture->isLoaded())
 #else
   if (this->dataPtr->texture && this->dataPtr->texture->isLoaded())
 #endif
~~~
content.html:
there are some codecheck errors:

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_rendering-ci-pr_any-xenial-amd64/22/cppcheckResult/

I think the following patch will fix them all:

diff -r 62e72338329d ogre/src/OgreRenderEngine.cc
--- a/ogre/src/OgreRenderEngine.cc  Wed Jun 27 00:14:09 2018 +0200
+++ b/ogre/src/OgreRenderEngine.cc  Wed Jun 27 15:00:27 2018 -0700
@@ -219,11 +219,13 @@
                 Ogre::MaterialManager::getSingleton().getByName(
                     fullPath);

+              bool matPtrNotNull;
               #if (OGRE_VERSION_MAJOR == 1 && OGRE_VERSION_MAJOR < 10)
-              if (! matPtr.isNull())
-              #elif
-              if (matPtr)
+              matPtrNotNull = !matPtr.isNull();
+              #else
+              matPtrNotNull = matPtr != nullptr;
               #endif
+              if (matPtrNotNull)
               {
                 // is this necessary to do here? Someday try it without
                 matPtr->compile();
diff -r 62e72338329d ogre/src/OgreSelectionBuffer.cc
--- a/ogre/src/OgreSelectionBuffer.cc   Wed Jun 27 00:14:09 2018 +0200
+++ b/ogre/src/OgreSelectionBuffer.cc   Wed Jun 27 15:00:27 2018 -0700
@@ -131,7 +131,7 @@
 void OgreSelectionBuffer::DeleteRTTBuffer()
 {
 #if OGRE_VERSION_MAJOR == 1 && OGRE_VERSION_MINOR < 10
-  if (! this->dataPtr->texture.isNull() && this->dataPtr->texture->isLoaded())
+  if (!this->dataPtr->texture.isNull() && this->dataPtr->texture->isLoaded())
 #else
   if (this->dataPtr->texture && this->dataPtr->texture->isLoaded())
 #endif

content.raw:
still 2 warnings:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_rendering-ci-pr_any-xenial-amd64&build=29)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_rendering-ci-pr_any-xenial-amd64/29/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_rendering-ci-pr_any-xenial-amd64/29/cppcheckResult/

this should fix it:

~~~
diff -r d82ae3187c2b ogre/src/OgreRenderEngine.cc
--- a/ogre/src/OgreRenderEngine.cc      Fri Jun 29 10:43:30 2018 -0700
+++ b/ogre/src/OgreRenderEngine.cc      Fri Jun 29 11:47:32 2018 -0700
@@ -218,11 +218,14 @@
               Ogre::MaterialPtr matPtr =
                 Ogre::MaterialManager::getSingleton().getByName(
                     fullPath);
+
+              bool matPtrNotNull;
 #if (OGRE_VERSION_MAJOR == 1 && OGRE_VERSION_MAJOR < 10)
-              if (!matPtr.isNull())
-#elif
-              if (matPtr)
+              matPtrNotNull = !matPtr.isNull();
+#else
+              matPtrNotNull = matPtr != nullptr;
 #endif
+              if (matPtrNotNull)
               {
                 // is this necessary to do here? Someday try it without
                 matPtr->compile();
~~~
content.html:
still 2 warnings:

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_rendering-ci-pr_any-xenial-amd64/29/cppcheckResult/

this should fix it:

diff -r d82ae3187c2b ogre/src/OgreRenderEngine.cc
--- a/ogre/src/OgreRenderEngine.cc      Fri Jun 29 10:43:30 2018 -0700
+++ b/ogre/src/OgreRenderEngine.cc      Fri Jun 29 11:47:32 2018 -0700
@@ -218,11 +218,14 @@
               Ogre::MaterialPtr matPtr =
                 Ogre::MaterialManager::getSingleton().getByName(
                     fullPath);
+
+              bool matPtrNotNull;
 #if (OGRE_VERSION_MAJOR == 1 && OGRE_VERSION_MAJOR < 10)
-              if (!matPtr.isNull())
-#elif
-              if (matPtr)
+              matPtrNotNull = !matPtr.isNull();
+#else
+              matPtrNotNull = matPtr != nullptr;
 #endif
+              if (matPtrNotNull)
               {
                 // is this necessary to do here? Someday try it without
                 matPtr->compile();

pullrequest.title: Several MSVC fixes: standard pointers and enable FreeImage/Ogre in Windows (take II)

content.raw:
it looks like c++11 `std::shared_ptr` is fully in use as of 10.11

* https://github.com/OGRECave/ogre/blob/v1.11.0/OgreMain/include/OgreSharedPtr.h#L57

but they added added methods in 1.10.1 to match the c++11 syntax

* https://github.com/OGRECave/ogre/commit/f83c19eae85e82302506526c60f902a5693de1d4

that fancy logic wasn't present in 1.10.0 though

* https://github.com/OGRECave/ogre/blob/v1.10.0/OgreMain/include/OgreSharedPtr.h
content.html:
it looks like c++11 std::shared_ptr is fully in use as of 10.11

  • https://github.com/OGRECave/ogre/blob/v1.11.0/OgreMain/include/OgreSharedPtr.h#L57

but they added added methods in 1.10.1 to match the c++11 syntax

  • https://github.com/OGRECave/ogre/commit/f83c19eae85e82302506526c60f902a5693de1d4

that fancy logic wasn't present in 1.10.0 though

  • https://github.com/OGRECave/ogre/blob/v1.10.0/OgreMain/include/OgreSharedPtr.h

pullrequest.title: Several MSVC fixes: standard pointers and enable FreeImage/Ogre in Windows (take II)

content.raw: Thanks for the research. The following logic should leave out the code that does not implement the standard pointers interface \(1.10.1 and above\) `#if (OGRE_VERSION_MAJOR == 1 && OGRE_VERSION_MINOR < 10 && OGRE_VERSION_PATCH < 1)`, correct?
content.html: Thanks for the research. The following logic should leave out the code that does not implement the standard pointers interface (1.10.1 and above) #if (OGRE_VERSION_MAJOR == 1 && OGRE_VERSION_MINOR < 10 && OGRE_VERSION_PATCH < 1), correct?

pullrequest.title: Several MSVC fixes: standard pointers and enable FreeImage/Ogre in Windows (take II)

content.raw: I think so, we could also consider making a helper variable `OGRE_VERSION_LT_1.10.1` to keep the code more concise
content.html: I think so, we could also consider making a helper variable OGRE_VERSION_LT_1.10.1 to keep the code more concise

content.raw: in the PR description you mentioned that FreeImage is enabled for OGRE. So does that mean the we need to update `REQUIRED_BY` and `PRIVATE_FOR` to include `ogre` as well?

pullrequest.title: Several MSVC fixes: standard pointers and enable FreeImage/Ogre in Windows (take II)

content.raw: Oh I did not mean that. The point was to enable FreeImage and Ogre for Windows since both were excluded in cmake but it does not imply interdependency. Looking at the code now seems like we are only using it for Optix so your sentence makes sense but change ogre by Optix. And I just realized that the code is already doing this.
content.html: Oh I did not mean that. The point was to enable FreeImage and Ogre for Windows since both were excluded in cmake but it does not imply interdependency. Looking at the code now seems like we are only using it for Optix so your sentence makes sense but change ogre by Optix. And I just realized that the code is already doing this.

pullrequest.title: Several MSVC fixes: standard pointers and enable FreeImage/Ogre in Windows (take II)

content.raw:
oops, I just realized a bug in this logic. I think `OGRE_VERSION_LT_1_10_1` will be false for `1.9.5` since its patch version is too high. Also `1.10.1` won't work.

Maybe define the variable in cmake using `VERSION_LESS` and pass it in to a header file?

* https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/01c7f8b1d68448bc618b575ad1c7ec13fee2b87f/cmake/SearchForStuff.cmake#lines-550:552
content.html:
oops, I just realized a bug in this logic. I think OGRE_VERSION_LT_1_10_1 will be false for 1.9.5 since its patch version is too high. Also 1.10.1 won't work.

Maybe define the variable in cmake using VERSION_LESS and pass it in to a header file?

  • https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/01c7f8b1d68448bc618b575ad1c7ec13fee2b87f/cmake/SearchForStuff.cmake#lines-550:552
